article: Last Tuesday I took two daughters, aged five and seven, to town by car. It began to rain _ , so I decided I would leave the children in the car _ I rushed into a shop. I warned the girls not to _ anything and told them I would be back within a few minutes. Then I locked all the doors and left _ happily out of the window. I returned to the car in less than five minutes but the girls had _ ! I could hardly believe my eyes. The car doors were _ locked, the windows tightly shut and on the back seat were only two coats. Being _ , I ran to the corner of the street _ there was no sign of them. I rushed up to an old lady nearby and asked _ she had seen two small girls but she said "No". Feeling quite sick with fear, I sat on the driver's seat, and went to stop trembling . Suddenly, I heard a merry laugh _ me. I got out of the car, ran round to open the boot and inside were two very red-faced and _ children. They had obviously pulled out the back seat, climbed behind it and then been unable to push the seat forward again. _ tears in my eyes, I leaned forward and pulled their ears.
